example: We should learn to live in harmony with nature.
logic: NAT (Birth) - 生来如此的世界

example: The weather is sunny and warm today.
logic: 来自气压与风的状态

example: The sky looked gloomy, as if it was about to rain.
logic: 阴暗压抑的感官视觉

example: It was an overcast morning with no sunlight.
logic: OVER (在上) + CAST (抛/盖) - 阴云覆盖

example: The road is hard to see because it’s foggy.
logic: 低空水汽导致的视线阻碍

example: A sudden gale blew off the roofs of several houses.
logic: 强力气流运动

example: The flood turned the small town into a disaster zone.
logic: DIS (坏) + ASTER (星) - 星象错误导致的厄运

example: War is a man-made calamity that brings endless suffering.
logic: 古法语 - 引起极大不幸的打击

example: The oil spill was an environmental catastrophe.
logic: CATA (下) + STROPHE (转) - 天崩地裂的转折

example: A blizzard shut down the entire city.
logic: 拟声词 - 强力闪击与风雪

example: A twister tore through the Midwest last night.
logic: 扭转运动的强力气旋

example: Hurricane Katrina caused widespread damage.
logic: 加勒比风神 - 特大热带气旋

example: The typhoon is expected to make landfall tomorrow.
logic: 希腊巨妖 Typhon - 太平洋热带气旋

example: A powerful tornado destroyed hundreds of homes.
logic: THUNDER (雷) + TURN (转) - 毁灭性陆地气旋

example: The 2011 Japanese earthquake was devastating.
logic: EARTH + QUAKE - 大地的震颤

example: The climbers were caught in an avalanche.
logic: 滑落/崩塌的高山积雪

example: The long drought has affected crop production.
logic: DRY - 极端缺水的状态

example: The river flooded the nearby villages.
logic: 溢出的流动水体

example: A tsunami struck after the undersea earthquake.
logic: 日语 - 津 (港口) + 波 (浪)

example: The volcanic eruption sent ash miles into the sky.
logic: E (出) + RUPT (断/破) - 核心喷涌而出

example: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun.
logic: 大地、泥土、人类居所

example: She pointed to France on the globe.
logic: 圆球状的物体

example: The Earth is almost a perfect sphere.
logic: SPHAIRA (Ball) - 球体及覆盖范围

example: Mars is the fourth planet in our solar system.
logic: 漫游者 - 在星空中穿梭的星体

example: The Northern Hemisphere has four distinct seasons.
logic: HEMI (一半) + SPHERE - 地球的一半

example: Pollution has damaged the Earth’s atmosphere.
logic: ATMOS (蒸汽) + SPHERE - 包围地球的气层

example: Polar bears live near the North Pole.
logic: 地球轴心的顶端点

example: The Arctic is warming faster than the rest of the world.
logic: 希腊语 '大熊座' - 指向北方

example: Penguins are native to the South Pole.
logic: 地球轴心的底端点

example: The Antarctic is covered in ice.
logic: ANT (相对) + ARCTIC - 北极的对面

example: Most of Europe is in the Northern Hemisphere.
logic: 赤道以北的地球部分

example: Australia lies in the Southern Hemisphere.
logic: 赤道以南的地球部分

example: The equator divides the Earth into two hemispheres.
logic: EQU (等分) - 将地球平分的圆周

example: Tokyo is at 139 degrees east longitude.
logic: LONG (长) - 纵向的长度测量

example: The city lies at a latitude of 40°N.
logic: LAT (宽) - 横向的宽度测量

example: The airplane reached an altitude of 10,000 meters.
logic: ALT (高) - 垂直高度高度

example: She has an aptitude for science.
logic: APT (适应/契合) - 天生适合的能力

example: His attitude toward failure is very positive.
logic: ATT (姿态/适合) - 面对世界的姿势

example: The world is divided into several climate zones.
logic: 基于地理位置的气候分类

example: The frigid zone includes the polar regions.
logic: FRIG (冷) - 极地严寒地带

example: Most of Europe lies in the temperate zone.
logic: TEMP (节制) - 气候温和不极端的区域

example: The tropical zone is hot and humid year-round.
logic: TROP (转) - 太阳回归线之间的区域
